org.akubraproject
Interface BlobStoreConnection

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBlobStoreConnection, AbstractMuxConnection, AbstractTransactionalConnection, BlobStoreConnectionWrapper, SQLTransactionalConnection, TransactionalConnection
public interface BlobStoreConnection

Interface to abstract the idea of a connection to a transaction based blob store

Author:
Chris Wilper, Pradeep Krishnan, Ronald Tschal√§r

Method Detail

getBlobStore

BlobStore getBlobStore()
Gets the blob store associated with this connection.

Returns:
the blob store.

getBlob

Blob getBlob(URI blobId,
             Map<String,String> hints)
             throws IOException,
                    UnsupportedIdException,
                    UnsupportedOperationException
Gets the blob with the given id.

Parameters:
blobId - the blob id; may be null if the store supports id-generation
hints - A set of hints to allow the implementation to optimize the operation (can be null)
Returns:
the blob. Cannot be null and must have the passed in blobId if blobId is not null. If the passed in blobId is null, a new and unique (for the store) id must be generated if the store is capable of generating ids; the thus returned blob may exist, in which case it will have an empty content. In either case there is no requirement that the returned blob must exist. However there is a requirement that the getConnection() method of the returned Blob must return this connection object.
Throws:
IOException - for IO errors
UnsupportedIdException - if blobId is not in a recognized/usable pattern by this store
UnsupportedOperationException - if blobId is null and this store is not capable of generating ids.

getBlob

Blob getBlob(InputStream content,
             long estimatedSize,
             Map<String,String> hints)
             throws IOException,
                    UnsupportedOperationException
Creates a blob with the given content. For Content Addressible Storage (CAS) systems, this is the only way to create a Blob; for all other stores there is also getBlob.openOutputStream.

Parameters:
content - the contents of the blob
estimatedSize - the estimated size of the data if known (or -1 if unknown). This can allow for the implementation to make better decisions on buffering or reserving space.
hints - A set of hints to allow the implementation to optimize the operation (can be null)
Returns:
the blob. Cannot be null and must have a generated id. The getConnection() method must return this connection object.
Throws:
IOException - for IO errors
UnsupportedOperationException - if this store cannot generate new id and create a new blob

listBlobIds

Iterator<URI> listBlobIds(String filterPrefix)
                          throws IOException
Gets an iterator over the ids of all blobs in this store.

Parameters:
filterPrefix - If not null, the list will be limited to those blob-ids beginning with this prefix.
Returns:
The iterator over the blob-ids.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurred getting the list of blob ids

sync

void sync()
          throws IOException,
                 UnsupportedOperationException
Flush all blobs associated with this connection and fsync. After this method completes all data should be comitted to stable storage (for stores that are backed by stable storage). However, whether this is really the case will depend on the storage used by the store (e.g. for a local filesystem based store it'll depend on the OS config and hardware, i.e. whether the disk's write cache is flushed or not).

This may or may not flush any open output-streams. For reliable results ensure that all output streams are closed before calling sync.

Throws:
IOException - if any error occurred trying to flush and sync
UnsupportedOperationException - if the store is not capable of syncing

close

void close()
Close the connection to the blob store. After this, all Blob and BlobStoreConnection operations except for getBlobStore, isClosed, close, Blob.getId, and Blob.getConnection will throw an IllegalStateException.

This method is idempotent and may be called multiple times.

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Tests if the connection to the blob store is closed.

Returns:
true if the connection is closed.
See Also:
close()
